casebody.data:
Ricky Glendall DAVIS, Plaintiff-Appellant, v. Timothy A. SMITH, Patrol Officer, Suffolk Police Department; J.R. Rivera, Patrol Officer, Suffolk Police Department, Defendants-Appellees. No. 10-7520. United States Court of Appeals, Fourth Circuit. Submitted: Feb. 28, 2011. Decided: March 9, 2011. Ricky Glendall Davis, Appellant Pro Se. D. Rossen S. Greene, Pender & Coward, Suffolk, Virginia, for Appellees. Before TRAXLER, Chief Judge, and KING and DIAZ, Circuit Judges.

Affirmed by unpublished PER CURIAM opinion.

Unpublished opinions are not binding precedent in this circuit.

PER CURIAM:

Ricky Glendall Davis, a state prisoner, appeals the district court’s order denying relief on his 42 U.S.C. § 1983 (2006) complaint. We have reviewed the record and find no reversible error. Accordingly, we affirm for the reasons stated by the district court. Davis v. Smith, No. 3:09-ev-00274-HEH, 2010 WL 3835026 (E.D.Va. Sept. 28, 2010). We dispense with oral argument because the facts and legal contentions are adequately presented in the materials before the court and argument would not aid the decisional process.

AFFIRMED.
